title: FF Giza
text:
Fótbóltsfelagið Giza, commonly known as FF Giza, was a <a href="Faroe%20Islands">Faroese</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club from <a href="T%C3%B3rshavn">Tórshavn</a>.
History.
The club was founded on 1 January 1968 as Nólsoyar Ítróttarfelag. It was commonly known as NÍF Nólsoy or just NÍF.
It has represented the island of <a href="N%C3%B3lsoy">Nólsoy</a>. However, NÍF played its matches in <a href="Argir">Argir</a> and Tórshavn.
NÍF Nólsoy changed its name to FF Giza on 1 January 2010. It has also moved from Nólsoy to Tórshavn.
In 2011, FF Giza won the <a href="3.%20deild">3. deild</a> title, the first trophy in club's history, and was promoted to <a href="2.%20deild">2. deild</a>.
However, before the start of the 2012 season, the club merged with <a href="FC%20Hoyv%C3%ADk">FC Hoyvík</a> to create <a href="FC%20Hoyv%C3%ADk%20%282019%29">Giza Hoyvík</a>.
Stadium.
FF Giza played its home matches at <a href="Gundadalur">Gundadalur</a>'s lower field (Niðari vøllur) in Tórshavn, with the capacity of 1,000.
Previously, the club played its home matches at <a href="Inni%20%C3%AD%20Vika">Inni í Vika</a> in Argir.
